ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend German 120 to any student wishing to continue their German education from L1. I do think that the course can be repetitive and is limited by a rather inflexible curriculum, unfortunately; however, I think that if well-taught, it can really teach a student quite a lot about the German language and German culture.
Take it! Its a great language and the German Department offers many activities to help improve your proficiency if class is not enough!
I would definitely recommend the class to other students. It's a great continuation of GMAN 110.
Most things are continuous from German 110. If you can keep up with all the homeworks, including the reading, and study a couple of nights ahead for tests, you'll do well.

I've enjoyed German greatly, and I highly recommend it, especially to someone who loves music, history, classics, or the other humanities that can be better accessed through German primary and secondary sources.
